alert.note: Alert for Badlands Area; Central Black Hills; Eastern Foot Hills (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 31 at 11:58AM MST until January 31 at 6:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH THE AFTERNOON FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 320, 321, 322, 324, 325, 326, 332, 333, 334, AND 335 ACROSS SOUTHERN SOUTH DAKOTA... .Very warm, windy and dry conditions are developing across downslope areas of the central and southern Black Hills and southern portions of South Dakota, generally south of I-90, as a strong cold front pushes through. Expect gusty southwest to west winds to switch to the northwest later today behind the cold front. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 320, 324, AND 332... The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect until 6 PM MST this evening. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 320 Central Black Hills, 324 Eastern Foot Hills and 332 Badlands Area. * WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Badlands Area; Central Black Hills; Eastern Foot Hills
